security_audit.summary: This skill is a prompt-based investigation guide with 3 utility scripts for code analysis. All scripts only read files and output to stdout without network access, file writes, or credential handling. The static analyzer flagged 274 potential issues, but all are false positives caused by documentation examples and legitimate analysis terminology. No actual command execution, credential access, or network calls exist.

content.value_statement: Understanding new or complex codebases takes significant time and effort. This skill provides systematic investigation techniques to quickly map code structure, trace dependencies, identify patterns, and find key implementations without reading every file manually.
actual_capabilities: Map directory structures and identify architectural patterns
Trace import and dependency chains across files
Find main entry points across different project types
Recognize design patterns and coding conventions
Document execution flows with file references
Follow data transformations through the system
limitations: Does not execute or test code - only analyzes static code
Cannot modify or refactor code automatically
Analysis is based on file reading - no runtime behavior observation
Relies on existing code structure - obfuscated code may limit effectiveness

use_cases.title: Onboard to existing projects
use_cases.description: Quickly understand unfamiliar codebases when joining a new team or project

use_cases.title: Trace feature implementations
use_cases.description: Find exactly where specific features or logic are implemented with full context

use_cases.title: Map attack surfaces
use_cases.description: Understand code organization to identify potential security vulnerabilities

prompt_templates.title: Basic feature exploration
prompt_templates.prompt: How is the [feature name] feature implemented? Trace the execution flow from the entry point to the core logic.

prompt_templates.title: Dependency analysis
prompt_templates.prompt: What modules does [file/module] depend on? Show me the import chain and how it connects to other parts of the system.

prompt_templates.title: Pattern identification
prompt_templates.prompt: What architectural pattern does this codebase follow? Identify the key directories and their purposes.

prompt_templates.title: Deep dive analysis
prompt_templates.prompt: Do a thorough investigation of [component]. Include: entry points, execution flow, data transformations, dependencies, and related components. Reference all files with line numbers.

output_examples.input: How does the authentication flow work in this project?
output: 1. Request hits auth middleware (auth.ts:25) which checks for JWT token
2. Token is validated against the secret (tokenService.ts:42)
3. User ID is extracted and attached to request (auth.ts:55)
- src/config/auth.config.ts: Secret keys and expiration settings

output_examples.input: Where is the user API endpoint defined?
output: The endpoint is defined at line 12: `router.get('/users', userController.getAll)`
Function getAll (userController.ts:45) retrieves users from UserRepository

output_examples.input: What build system does this project use?
output: ### Build Tool: npm scripts with webpack
- npm run build: Compiles TypeScript and bundles with webpack
- npm run dev: Starts development server with hot reload
- npm test: Runs Jest test suite

best_practices: Start with high-level structure before diving into implementation details
Always reference specific files and line numbers in findings
Trace both execution flow and data transformations for complete understanding
anti_patterns: Reading every file linearly instead of targeting relevant code
Failing to verify findings by cross-referencing multiple sources
Not documenting where you found information as you investigate

faq.question: What programming languages does this skill support?
faq.answer: The skill works with any language. Scripts specifically support TypeScript, JavaScript, Python, Go, and Rust for import tracing and entry point detection.

faq.question: How deep does the dependency tracing go?
faq.answer: Default depth is 3 levels but can be configured. The Python scripts accept a --depth parameter to control how far they follow import chains.

faq.question: Can this skill integrate with other Claude skills?
faq.answer: Yes. The allowed tools include Task, so it can delegate to other agents for complex multi-step investigations.

faq.question: Is any code executed during analysis?
faq.answer: No. This skill only reads and analyzes code statically. It does not run or execute any code from the target codebase.

faq.question: Why are my findings different from expected?
faq.answer: Ensure you are looking at the correct files. Check package.json or project config to understand the actual entry points and structure before deep investigation.

faq.question: How is this different from simple grep searches?
faq.answer: This skill provides a systematic methodology with scripts for comprehensive analysis, not just keyword searches. It guides you through structural, dependency, and pattern analysis.
